SALEventSet.Enumeration: AxisMotionState_Stopping=0, AxisMotionState_Stopped=1, AxisMotionState_MovingPointToPoint=2, AxisMotionState_Jogging=3, AxisMotionState_Tracking=4, AxisMotionState_TrackingPaused=5

LimitsMask_L1Min=0x1, LimitsMask_L1Max=0x2, LimitsMask_L2Min=0x4, LimitsMask_L2Max=0x8, LimitsMask_L3Min=0x10, LimitsMask_L3Max=0x20, LimitsMask_AdjustableL1Min=0x40, LimitsMask_AdjustableL1Max=0x80, LimitsMask_OperationalL2Min=0x100, LimitsMask_OperationalL2Max=0x200, LimitsMask_CameraCableWrapFollowL3Min=0x400, LimitsMask_CameraCableWrapFollowL3Max=0x800
PowerState_Off=0, PowerState_On=1, PowerState_Fault=2, PowerState_TurningOn=3, PowerState_TurningOff=4, PowerState_Unknown=15

System_Azimuth=0, System_Elevation=1, System_CameraCableWrap=2, System_Balance=3, System_MirrorCovers=4, System_MirrorCoverLocks=5, System_AzimuthCableWrap=6, System_LockingPins=7, System_DeployablePlatforms=8, System_OilSupplySystem=9, System_AzimuthDrivesThermal=10, System_ElevationDrivesThermal=11, System_AZ0101CabinetThermal=12, System_ModbusTemperatureControllers=13, System_MainCabinet=14, System_MainAxesPowerSupply=15, System_TopEndChiller=16

SALEvent.Description: Available low-level controller settings.

item.Description: Comma-separated names.
Comma-separated descriptions.
Comma-separated created dates (ISO format).
Comma-separated modified dates (ISO format).

SALEvent.Description: Settings file used in the low-level controller.

item.Description: Settings file name.

SALEvent.Description: A selection of low-level controller settings for the azimuth axis.

item.Description: Min command position limit enabled?
Max command position limit enabled?
Min L1 (software) limit enabled?
Max L1 (software) limit enabled?
Min operational L1 (software) limit enabled. If true then minL1Limit is the operational limit, else it is the wider limit. Note that the TMA calls these "Adjustable" limits.
Max operational L1 (software) limit enabled. If true then maxL1Limit is the operational limit, else it is the wider limit. Note that the TMA calls these "Adjustable" limits.
Min L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Max L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Minimum commanded position. Ignored if minCmdPositionLimitEnabled is false.
Maximum commanded position. Ignored if maxCmdPositionLimitEnabled is false.
Minimum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on minOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if minOperationalL1LimitEnabled and minL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled and maxL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum commanded abs(velocity).
Maximum abs(velocity) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(acceleration) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(jerk) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(velocity) used for slewing and tracking.
Maximum abs(acceleration) used for slewing and tracking.
Maximum abs(jerk) used for slewing and tracking.

item.Description: Min command position limit enabled?
Max command position limit enabled?
Min L1 (software) limit enabled?
Max L1 (software) limit enabled?
Min operational L1 (software) limit enabled. If true then minL1Limit is the operational limit, else it is the wider limit. Note that the TMA calls these "Adjustable" limits.
Max operational L1 (software) limit enabled. If true then maxL1Limit is the operational limit, else it is the wider limit. Note that the TMA calls these "Adjustable" limits.
Min operational L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Max operational L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Min L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Max L2 (direction inhibit) limit switch enabled?
Minimum commanded position. Ignored if minCmdPositionLimitEnabled is false.
Maximum commanded position. Ignored if maxCmdPositionLimitEnabled is false.
Minimum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on minOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if minOperationalL1LimitEnabled and minL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled and maxL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum commanded abs(velocity).
Maximum abs(velocity) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(acceleration) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(jerk) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(velocity) used for slewing and tracking.
Maximum abs(acceleration) used for slewing and tracking.
Maximum abs(jerk) used for slewing and tracking.

SALEvent.Description: A selection of low-level controller settings for the camera cable wrap.

item.Description: L1 (software) position limits enabled?
L2 (direction inhibit) limit switches enabled?

Maximum commanded position. Ignored if maxCmdPositionLimitEnabled is false.
Minimum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on minOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if minOperationalL1LimitEnabled and minL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum L1 (software) position limit. The value depends on maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled. Ignored if maxOperationalL1LimitEnabled and maxL1LimitEnabled are both false.
Maximum commanded abs(velocity).
Maximum abs(velocity) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(acceleration) used for point to point moves.
Maximum abs(jerk) used for point to point moves.

Maximum abs(jerk) used for slewing and tracking.

SALEvent.Description: Is the elevation axis in position? If tracking, in position means the slew is done and the axes are now tracking the target.

item.Description: Is the axis in position?

SALEvent.Description: Is the azimuth axis in position? If tracking, in position means the slew is done and the axes are now tracking the target.

item.Description: Is the axis in position?

SALEvent.Description: Is the camera cable wrap in position? If tracking, in position means the slew is done and the axis is now tracking the target.

item.Description: In position?

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of the elevation axis.

item.Description: Motion state, as an AxisMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of the azimuth axis.

item.Description: Motion state, as an AxisMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of the camera cable wrap.

item.Description: Motion state, as an AxisMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: State of the limits for the elevation axis.

item.Description: Limits, as a LimitsMask enum mask.

SALEvent.Description: State of the limits for the azimuth axis.

item.Description: Limits, as a LimitsMask enum mask.

SALEvent.Description: State of the limits for the camera cable wrap.

item.Description: Camera cable wrap limits, as a LimitsMask enum mask.

SALEvent.Description: State of the topple block for the azimuth axis.

item.Description: Is the reverse topple block switch active?
Is the forward topple block switch active?

SALEvent.Description: Is camera cable wrap following enabled?

item.Description: If true (1) the camera cable wrap is trying to follow the rotator. If false (0) that code is not running. The field type should be "boolean", and we may change someday if we figure out how to migrate old data.

SALEvent.Description: Commanded position and velocity.

item.Description: Target camera cable wrap position.
Target camera cable wrap velocity.
TAI date at which the commanded positions and velocities apply, as unix time.

SALEvent.Description: Who controls the low-level controller.

item.Description: Who controls the low-level controller; a Commander enum.

SALEvent.Description: State of TCP/IP connection to the low level controller (the "operations manager").

item.Description: Is the command (client) socket connected (true=yes, false=no)?
Is the replies (server) socket connected (true=yes, false=no)?

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of deployable platforms.

item.Description: Aggregate motion state, a DeployableMotionState enum.
Motion state of each actuator, a DeployableMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of elevation locking pin.

item.Description: Aggregate motion state, an ElevationLockingPinMotionState enum.
Motion state of each actuator, an ElevationLockingPinMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: State of an error (identified by the code field).

item.Description: Is the error condition latched on (as it been active since it was last reset)?
Is the error condition present?
Error identifier code.
Text description of error.
Subsystem that produced the error; a single SubsystemId enumeration value.

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of the mirror cover locks.

item.Description: Aggregate motion state, a DeployableMotionState enum.
Motion state of each mirror cover, a DeployableMotionState enum.

SALEvent.Description: Motion state of the mirror covers.

item.Description: Aggregate motion state, a DeployableMotionState enum.
Motion state of each mirror cover lock, a DeployableMotionState enum.
A bit map for safety causes.
A bit map emergency stop buttons.
A bit map for limit switches.
A bit map for deployable platform switches.
A bit map for door, hatch and ladder status.
A bit map for mirror cover power off switches.
A bit map for locking pin positions.
A bit map for phase capacitor bank doors.
A bit map for brakes that failed.
A bit map for safety effects.

SALEvent.Description: Commanded position and velocity.

item.Description: Target mount elevation at the specified time.
Target mount elevation velocity at the specified time.
Target mount azimuth at the specified time. The allowed range is 0 to 360.
Target mount azimuth velocity at the specified time.
TAI date at which the commanded positions and velocities apply, as unix time.
Unique target identifier. Echoed from the trackTarget command.
Coordinate system of target: one of sidereal, non-sidereal or local. Echoed from the trackTarget command.
Coordinate reference frame of RA/DEC axes (e.g. ICRS or FK5). Echoed from the trackTarget command.

SALEvent.Description: State of a warning (dentified by the code field).

item.Description: Is the warning condition present?
Warning identifier code.
Text description of warning.
Subsystem that produced the warning; a single SubsystemId enumeration value.
